comments:
Websphere 6.0 can only publish ears, but the websphere 6.0
(websphere.6.serverdef) server defination only defines interest in web and ejb
modules:

<module>
<type>j2ee.web</type>
<publishDir>${wasHome}</publishDir>		               
<publisherReference>org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.websphere.antpublisher</publisherReference>
</module>

<module>
<type>j2ee.ejb</type>
<publishDir>${wasHome}</publishDir>
<publisherReference>org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.websphere.antpublisher</publisherReference>
</module>

resulting in the following exception when EAR deploy attempted.



clipse.wst.server.core 4 0 2005-09-28 14:13:22.101
!MESSAGE Could not publish to the server.
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.GenericServerBehaviour.publishModule(GenericServerBehaviour.java)
	at
org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publishModule(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:632)
	at
org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publishModules(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:685)
	at
org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publish(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:586)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.doPublish(Server.java:705)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.publish(Server.java:694)
	at
org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.PublishServerJob.run(PublishServerJob.java:145)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

Has anyone ever tried to get Websphere to work? Or am I missing something?

looks like the serverType definition in plugin.xml and the .serverdef file does
not agree with each other :) Assigning to Naci since his team maintains
websphere adapter.

Hey gorkem,

I always wondered why an IBM Webshpere commiter doesnt own the websphere server
def and adapter?

It seem like you guys get thrown in to the fire trying to supply all these?

As always, thanks for your quick response.

As per 9/29 status meeting, I understand this is not a valid bug, much less
blocking -- that there was some mixup on what was installed?

If I have misunderstood, please reopen and/or update.

If WTP is shipping a server adapter for any vendor it should work.  Given the 
fact that the adapter for WebSphere that is provided in WTP doesn't work with 
a very basic J2EE EAR structure I believe this would qualify as a bug.

As per 10/6 development status meeting, this was deemed a major bug, since it is
a "major loss of function" .. but, not "blocking". 

Thanks all.
*** Bug 113868 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 114101 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
websphere.6.x.xml is changed for publishing ears.
This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).

This bug is being moved to the "closed" state since it has been in the fixed state for a so long it is being assumed fixed, without explicit verification from the originator. If there is still a problem, in the most recent 1.5.x builds, please reopen or open another bug.
